result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Alexander Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Alexander Lowe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Alexander Lowe was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 29, 2016.
Upon successful completion of Probation and DJOC the Court will make Defendant eligible for expungement.
Court notes 1 day credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:Kaley Walker DF ATTY:  Brian J. Remington DF: Daniel Alexander Lowe appeared from jail. Case called at 10:02.  Includes 15CF298, 15CF444. Sentencing arguments. Court reviews charges with DE. DE makes a statement. 
In 15CF298
6 months St. Croix County Jail
Huber authorized for work and seek work. 

Court orders in 15CF444: Sentence W/H
2 years probation concurrent to jail time
30 days St. Croix County Jail condition time concurrent to 15CF298.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to finish AODA
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Anger management assessment and any recommended follow through. 
- DE to maintain employment. 
- Cost of 268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.

Court notes credit of  110 days.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY: Andrew Martin Nelson DF: Daniel Alexander Lowe appeared. Case called at 9:03. Includes 15CF298, 15CF444. Court reviews files.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF444, G of Ct. 4 in 15CF444. DE pleads G to amended Ct. 1 misdemeanor battery in 15CF298. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CF444 withholding entering the judgment in favor of the DJOC. Crt finds the DE guilty of Ct. 4 in 15CF444 and guilty of amended Ct. 1 to misdemeanor battery in 15CF298 and enters judgments today. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF298 and Ct. 2 and 3 in 15CF444. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

On 15CF298 Ct. 1  and Ct. 4 on 15CF444, Sentence W/H
2 years probation with conditions:
60 days condition time STAYED.
- Court notes 1 day credit against any ultimate sentence.
- AODA assessment. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Regular and random testing, or at agents discretion.
- DE to maintain employment/schooling.
- 40 hours of community service. 
-  DE to attend a vicitim impact panel. 
- Costs of $243.00 on both misdemeanors.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200 on both misdemeanors.
- Apply bond on file, remaining to be paid during probation.

Bond will be discharged on 15CF298.
Diversion coordinator to provide quarterly updates to the Court. DE to sign up for probation today.  Restitution info due to the Court within 30 days. 
Upon successful completion on probation and DJOC the Court will make DE eligible for expungement. 
Probation review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing at 10-19-2015 11:15 am

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Broderick M. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
